revised_title: Earth-based Observations of Comet Halley: Dust and Gas
tldr: This article discusses extensive ground-based observations of Comet Halley, focusing on its dust and gas content. The authors found that the emission of dust from the nucleus is sporadic and localized, rather than continuous, and that the dust and gas content of the coma change in parallel. The observations provide valuable information for understanding the composition and behavior of comets in the Solar System.
